title: Intel to build $20B Ohio chip facility amid global shortage
Intel Announces Plan to Build Ohio Chip-Making Facility Amid Global Shortage

sentence: Hours later, President Biden, Ohio governor Mike DeWine, US Secretary of Commerce Gina Raimondo, Intel CEO Pat Gelsinger, and other executives and local officials suggested the up-to-$100 billion development could be a panacea for a wide variety of issues, too — including global competitiveness, national security, the chip shortage, the high price of cars, racial and gender gaps in STEM employment, even inflation itself.
author: Sean Hollister
title: What we know about Intel’s $20 billion bet on Ohio

sentence: Gelsinger said that the new investment “marks another significant way Intel is leading the effort to restore U.S. semiconductor manufacturing leadership,” and that the coming factories “will create a new epicenter for advanced chipmaking in the U.S. that will bolster Intel’s domestic lab-to-fab pipeline and strengthen Ohio’s leadership in research and high tech.” Indirectly, the plants will also impact the state through new infrastructure in and around New Albany to support the project, and an even stronger emphasis on STEM educational opportunities for local schools.” The project will add $2.8 billion to Ohio’s annual gross state product, according to Governor Mike DeWine.
title: Ohio Aims to Become 'Silicon Heartland'

author: Story Hinckley
title: ‘Silicon Heartland’? Why Ohio could be next US tech stronghold.
